```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tufte)
library(knitr)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(tidy = FALSE, cache.extra = packageVersion('tufte'), echo = TRUE, fig.margin=FALSE, fig.show = "asis", fig.align = "center", fig.width = 6, fig.asp = 0.618)
```

# R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

You can embed an R code chunk like this^[When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document.]:

```{r}
summary(cars)  # summary of cars
```

# Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r, fig.cap="Pressure vs Temperature"}
plot(pressure)
```

# Tables

```{r, echo=FALSE}
kable(
  head(ChickWeight), caption = "Chicky information."
)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
kable(
read.table(header = T, text = "
      Gr     Out  n
      Rx     Imp  8
      Rx Not_Imp  4
 Waiting     Imp  3
 Waiting Not_Imp 10                   
"),
caption = "Patient information"
)
```
